parameter 1: Season one episodes also exist in hour-length form, with "in-depth interviews with spiritual teachers and unconventional icons" and concluding remarks by philosopher Ken Wilber. In the extended version of episode 1.1, Stuart explores polyamory with Kendra and Decker Cunov. The 30-minute broadcast version omits these portions of the program; the extended versions are available at the official website.
parameter 2: Season one episodes also exist in hour-length form, with "in-depth interviews with spiritual teachers and unconventional icons" and concluding remarks by philosopher Ken Wilber. In the extended version of episode 1.3, Stuart explores meditation and hallucination with Zen Master Genpo Roshi. The 30-minute broadcast version omits these portions of the program; the extended versions are available at the official website.
parameter 3: When the original Episodes 25 and 26 caused an uproar after airing in Japan, the series' creator announced that there would be an OAV (Original Anime Video) "remaking" the two episodes. This became _Shin seiki Evangelion Gekijô-ban: Air/Magokoro wo, kimi ni (1997)_ (qv), which is not necessarily a "remake", but an alternate version of the final two episodes.
parameter 4: Season one episodes also exist in hour-length form, with "in-depth interviews with spiritual teachers and unconventional icons" and concluding remarks by philosopher Ken Wilber. In the extended version of episode 1.3, Stuart explores meditation and hallucination with Zen Master Genpo Roshi. The 30-minute broadcast version omits these portions of the program; the extended versions are available at the official website.
parameter 5: Season one episodes also exist in hour-length form, with "in-depth interviews with spiritual teachers and unconventional icons" and concluding remarks by philosopher Ken Wilber. In the extended version of episode 1.6, Stuart looks at the more profound dimensions of the alien encounter enigma with Will Bueché and Dr. David Lukoff. The 30-minute broadcast version omits these portions of the program; the extended versions are available at the official website.

parameter 22: This episode was also released theatrically in March 1987 as part of distributor Toei's Manga Festival, under the title "Shin Maple Town Monogatari: Palm Town Hen". Among the differences between this and the on-air counterpart: - An extended flashback sequence, edited from scenes of the 52nd and final episode of the original "Maple Town" show. - The on-screen title, seen (and announced by Patty Rabbit) as "Konnichiwa! Atarashi i machi".
parameter 23: Also released on video in an edited, 'feature length' version.
